snippet.title: Charting a course for the cloud: The role of the IEEE
snippet.description: Nick Hardiman takes a look at the evolving cloud computing standard. Is an industry-wide standard possible? Who has the authority to issue standards?

snippet.title: Net neutrality: Seven questions for the new Internet rule makers
snippet.description: Mark Underwood tries to untangle some of the technical and political threads in the net neutrality debate. He offers seven key questions that the new Internet rule makers need to a...

snippet.title: WPA/WPA2 encryption: A possible workaround
snippet.description: It seems using WPA or WPA2 is not as secure as we would like to believe. It's not the end of the world, but important enough to learn what's going on.

snippet.title: Review: HTC Droid Eris
snippet.description: Although the HTC Droid Eris hasn't received as much press as the Motorola Droid, Shawn Morton explains why it may be better device for most smartphone users.

snippet.title: Swarm Intelligence: Are digital ants the answer to malware?
snippet.description: Modeling Nature may be the best way to solve the malware problem. Learn how digital ants could be the answer.

snippet.title: Learn why 250GB is not ever reported as 250GB
snippet.description: Upon close examination of your hard drive in Windows, you will notice that the number of gigabytes actually available is not as much as advertised.

snippet.title: Symantec's dirtiest websites
snippet.description: Symantec issued a list of 100 "Dirtiest Websites of Summer 2009", which have an average of 18,000 threats.

snippet.title: Enabling drive-level encryption is only the beginning
snippet.description: The TCG released a new standard for encryption at drive-level. Sounds good, but how does this actually impact enterprise data encryption efforts, particularly pre-boot authenticat...

snippet.title: Nope
snippet.description: unless you get illegal copies Why don't you join the ACM (acm.org) or the IEEE computer society (computer.org) both are about $100 per year. while member you get access to skill...

snippet.title: SolutionBase: Introducing Network Access Protection for Windows
snippet.description: Microsoft is now offering network access protection to prohibit systems that fail a health check from entering your network. This article, part of an exclusive TechRepublic serie...
